Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Georgia: Foreign citizens are now allowed to enter Georgia under the following conditions:
(1) Unrestricted entry by air for citizens of any country who have documentary proof of having either received a full course of COVID-19 vaccination, or of having been infected with COVID within the previous 100 days and having had the first jab in a two-dose vaccination process. If you arrive by land or sea, you will also need to present a negative PCR test taken within the previous 72 hours.
(2) Other nationals can enter Georgia provided your travel to Georgia originated in one of the other countries listed on the Ministry of Foreign Affairs website. You must travel by air and submit a travel history in advance, present on arrival a negative PCR test taken within the previous 72 hours and take a further PCR test at your own expense on your third day in Georgia.
Mandatory 14-day quarantine, followed by a PCR test is imposed on anyone who has been in South Africa, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Namibia, Lesotho, Eswatini, Mozambique or Malawi in the previous 14-day period.
Children under 10 are exempted from PCR tests.
*Demonstrating your COVID-19 status: Georgia may request proof of vaccination upon entry.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Georgia: Inter-city and municipal public transport and taxis are operating normally. Face masks must be worn in all public transport and taxis.
*Accommodation: Most hotels and other rental accommodation are open. Face masks must be worn when entering public spaces inside hotels and rental accommodation.
*Public spaces and services: Georgia introduced a COVID “green pass” system on 1 December 2021. You will need to prove your “green” status in order to enter:
• Hotels and other accommodation
• Food outlets (open and closed spaces of restaurants, cafes, bars-including shopping malls)
• Cinemas, theatres, concert halls and entertainment facilities,
• Spas & gyms
• Ski lifts
“Green” status will be granted if you are:
• Fully vaccinated;
• With 72-hour validity negative PCR test;
• With 24-hour validity negative antigen-fast test;
• Have had a documented Covid-19 infection during the previous 6 months
You can prove your “green” status by:
• QR code obtained by registration in the application Is “CovidPass” Georgia;
• QR code obtained by registering on the COVIDPASS Website
• Documents printed in vaccination centres, clinics and justice houses in Georgia which have the appropriate QR code
The Georgian authorities recommend that foreign nationals who entered Georgia before 1 December and reside in Georgia should use the “Covid Pass Georgia” application to obtain “green” status If you are visiting Georgia after 1 December 2021 should use the EU Digital COVID Certificate system, you can use the same printed or digital documents which you present on entry to Georgia. Full details on the green pass system are available in English on the Provax.ge and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs It is mandatory to wear masks in public places indoors (shops, hotels etc) and outdoors. Failing to do so can result in a 20 Lari fine for an individual or 500 Lari for a legal entity.
Social distancing requirements remain in place. Large celebratory gatherings such as weddings remain banned.
Systematic COVID-19 testing of staff working in trading, catering and teaching professions is taking place. You can find full details of the latest restrictions from the Government of Georgia.
